page.title: 03 St Nicholas Church
page.content: The second church in the Eastern half of the block is in{Tytherton {Lucas}and is dedicated to{St Nicholas, better known as Father Christmas. We do not know when the church was built, but in 1272 the chapel and rectory of St Nicholas belonged to the Parish Church of Chippenham. About two hundred years ago it burnt down but was rebuilt. The large font is possibly of Norman date. The chancel and side aisles have thirteen stained glass windows. There is a single bell and most of the wall memorials are in memory of the Crook family.There is a service every Sunday: the first and third Sundays in the month are Holy Communion, Mattins is on the second and fourth and if there is a fifth Sunday it is Family Communion. The vicar is the parish priest of Chippenham.
